thread.title: AB InBev understood to be exploring exit from SABMiller's US venture
thread.title_full: AB InBev understood to be exploring exit from SABMiller's US venture

title: AB InBev understood to be exploring exit from SABMiller's US venture
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Oct 14, 2015, 22:36 BST - UK Markets closed AB InBev understood to be exploring exit from SABMiller's US venture By Ben Martin | Telegraph – 1 hour 5 minutes ago 0.00 0.00 
The Belgian-Brazilian giant has started to gauge the interest of Molson Coors, SAB’s partner, about taking full control of MillerCoors 
Anheuser-Busch InBev is exploring a potential exit from SABMiller’s American joint venture in a deal that could be worth $10bn (£6.5bn). 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) is understood that the Belgian-Brazilian giant has started to gauge the interest of SAB’s partner, the American-Canadian brewer Molson Coors, about taking full control of MillerCoors. 
FTSE 100-listed SAB holds 58pc of MillerCoors, with the remaining 42pc held by Molson Coors. AB InBev’s mooted £68bn takeover of SAB , announced on Tuesday, is almost certainly going to require the disposal of the London-listed company’s interest in the venture because of expected regulatory concerns about competition. 
Molson Coors is the obvious buyer of the stake. An acquisition of SAB a so-called change of control - automatically gives Molson Coors the right to lift its interest in the joint venture to 50pc and name a chief executive of the business. It then also has first and last refusal over buying out the remaining 50pc. 
AB InBev and SAB have struck an “agreement in principle” for what would be Britain’s biggest ever takeover . The Belgian-Brazilian brewer behind Budweiser and Stella Artois has until October 28 to make a formal offer for SAB. 
Spokesmen for AB InBev and SAB declined to comment. Molson Coors did not return requests for comment.
